radiographic_examinations.findings: Significantly increased blood-flow, blood-pool, and delayed-phase radioactivity over both feet compatible with clinically indicated Reflex Sympathetic Dystrophy (RSD).
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Follow-up three-phase bone scintigraphy showed less diffuse radioactivity over the feet than the previous study, indicating a good response to calcitonin therapy.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Less diffuse radioactivity over the feet compared to the initial study.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Bone-to-soft tissue ratios changed from 12.6 before treatment to 6.6 after treatment, indicating decreased radionuclide uptake.
